page.title: 13Religion. Biography.
page.content: The Tannery is useful to the area because it is one of Downton's main employers. {The Parish Church of St. Laurence. St. Laurence church dates back to 1150 but the original Norman building has been enlarged. Two bays have been added to make a cross shape. In 1791, the church tower was extended by 30 feet so that Lord Radnor could see it from his estate. In 1860, it was lowered to its original height for safety reasons. Inside the chapel arch there is s hole called the 'priest's squint:' this allowed the priest at the altar in the side chapel to see what the priest at the high altar was doing. The church tower has eight bells the oldest of which is dated 1604. The oldest of the log books dates back to 1599. We spoke to Canon D. Letcher, Vicar of St. Laurence's.
